trans-unit.source: Specifies the types of security available to a service endpoint configured to receive HTTP requests.
WebHttpSecurity provides the security requirements for an endpoint configured with a <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding>.

If the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode> value is specified by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding.%23ctor%28System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode%29> method, then the settings provided by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurity.Transport%2A> property become effective for the service endpoint.

The value of <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode> can only be set in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding> constructor that takes it as an explicit parameter and its value cannot be set again after the binding instance is created.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurity"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the mode of security that is used by an endpoint configured to receive HTTP requests with a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding"></xref>.
This property determines whether the settings from the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurity.Transport%2A> property becomes effective.
A value of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode"></xref> that indicates whether transport-level security or no security is used by an endpoint.
The default value is <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode"></xref>.
The value is not a valid <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode"></xref>.
Specifies whether the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurity.Mode*> property has changed from its default and should be serialized.
This is used for XAML integration.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurity.Mode*> property value should be serialized; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns a value that indicates whether the Transport property has changed from its default value and should be serialized.
This is used by WCF for XAML integration.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurity.Transport*> property value should be serialized; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets an object that contains the transport-level security settings for this binding.
Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.HttpTransportSecurity> object returned by this property to set the transport security parameters for the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding>.

If the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode> value is specified by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding.%23ctor%28System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode%29> method, then the settings provided by the Transport property become effective for the service endpoint.

If the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode> value is specified by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding.%23ctor%28System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode%29> method, then the settings provided by the Transport property become effective for the service endpoint.

The value of <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpSecurityMode> can only be set in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WebHttpBinding> constructor that takes it as an explicit parameter and its value cannot be set again after the binding instance is created.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.HttpTransportSecurity> for this binding.

The default values set are a <xref:System.ServiceModel.HttpTransportSecurity.ClientCredentialType*> of <xref:System.ServiceModel.HttpClientCredentialType>, a <xref:System.ServiceModel.HttpTransportSecurity.ProxyCredentialType*> of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.HttpProxyCredentialType"></xref>, and <xref:System.ServiceModel.HttpTransportSecurity.Realm*> = "".
